Connectivity#

Module Contents#

Classes#

Connectivity

This class contains information about connectivity between neurons in the oscillatory network.
class Connectivity.Connectivity(params_ping: src.params.ParamsPING.ParamsPING, coupling_weights: numpy.ndarray[int, int, float])#

This class contains information about connectivity between neurons in the oscillatory network.

The interaction strength of lateral connections is represented by a matrix \(K\) of pairwise coupling weights defined by an exponential function decaying by the Euclidean distance between the PING networks they belong to:

\(K_{v, w} = C_{ \mathsf{type}(v), \mathsf{type}(w)} \exp (-\| \mathsf{cmap}(v), \mathsf{cmap}(w) \| / s_{v, w}),\)

where

  • \(v, w\) are two arbitrary neurons in the network,

  • \(\mathsf{type}(v)\) maps a neuron to its type (see NeuronTypes),

  • \(\mathsf{cmap}(v)\) maps a neuron to its grid_location in the visual cortex (see StimulusLocations),

  • \(s_{v, w}\) is the spatial constant (see ParamsConnectivity).

The coupling weights are a part of current (see CurrentComponents). This equation was introduced in [Izhikevich, 2003]. This class performs the assignment of neurons to relevant PING networks arranged in a grid and computes the matrix of coupling weights.

Parameters

  • params_ping (ParamsPING) – parameters describing PING networks and their composition.

  • coupling_weights (numpy.ndarray[(int, int), float]) – coupling weights between all pairs of neurons.

Variables

  • params_ping – parameters describing PING networks and their composition.

  • coupling_weights – coupling weights between all pairs of neurons.
